quest.name: His Park Materials
journal: Jullus finds himself in the somewhat bizarre position of leading ambassadors of an enemy contingent on a salvage mission.
objectives: Search for ceruleum in Forum Solius.
Search for ceruleum at the designated location.
Deliver the temperature regulator ceruleum tank to Jullus.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Although this is hardly the solution we had in mind, it will have to suffice for the time being.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Without our healing magicks, there's little we can do for these people beyond offer words of encouragement. But this way we'll be able to offer them tangible assistance.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: We will begin our search for ceruleum in Regio Urbanissima.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: The first location is Forum Solius, a park to the northwest of this station.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: You are to remain close at all times and act only as ordered. Follow me.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: To think this macabre graveyard for warmachina was once a park...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: This is the place.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So, this is the park... I'm surprised they found space for one amongst all these buildings.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Actually, the recreational areas came first. The houses were later built around them.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: "A healthy society requires communal spaces for children to play, and adults to socialize.“

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: This park was named after the founding father of the Empire, the great Solus zos Galvus.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Did we come to extract ceruleum from the wrecked magitek armor?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: No, we've already drained it dry. Same goes for the rest of the machina in the vicinity.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: But as our ceruleum has been stolen, we must scour the city for every last drop.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: And while I don't expect to find anything here, I've decided to try one more time, in case something has been overlooked.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I see. Then with your permission, we will commence the search.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I don't imagine there would be much need for magitek in a park of all places, but then again, I wasn't raised in Garlemald. They may have uses for ceruleum that I've yet to consider.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This...whatever-it-is appears to have some sort of symbolic meaning relating to this park. Even though the place is named after Solus, it doesn't seem to be a statue of him. Well, at least not anymore.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Maybe it was once a fountain? Or somewhere the man himself used to sit? Not that it would matter, even if we knew, but I can't help wondering.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Jullus ignores you as he stares at the water in silence, as if searching for something he knows has gone and will never return...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Though rather small by Garlean standards, the structure is reminiscent of a merchant's stall. Perhaps it was built for children to play at shopkeeper.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: There is nothing inside resembling magitek or any other devices that would be fueled by ceruleum...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Several points of interest are marked on the map of Forum Solius. The pond, children's play areas... To your knowledge, however, none would require the use of ceruleum.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A cursory inspection of the wrecked magitek armor confirms that the fuel canisters have long since been drained of ceruleum, as Jullus said.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The contraption is built in the style of imperial warmachina armed with a battery of weapons and capable of transforming into different configurations...but on closer inspection, it appears to be no more than a children's slide.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Oh, it's you. Any luck?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: There's no sign of any ceruleum.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Hmm... Hardly surprising, but disappointing nonetheless.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I couldn't help noticing you gazing at the pond. Is something the matter?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: What? Yes─ I mean, no, I'm...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: It's just...I used to bring my brother and sister here to play.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: The pond was heated to stop it from freezing over, so like all the other children, they just had to wade in and splash about. Would've stayed there if I didn't drag them out. We'd be sopping wet when all was said and done. Every time.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: And every time, when we'd get home, Mother would scold us, saying we'd catch our death walking around like that...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The pond was heated...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: With a ceruleum-powered heater, by chance?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: I suppose it must have been... Come to think of it, I remember seeing engineers changing out a tank beneath a hatch...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: But that was a long time ago, when the water still flowed clear and wasn't this...brackish muck.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: We can't see a thing, and I can't remember where the hatch might be.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: With the machinery most likely broken, the amount of filth in there is probably the only reason it hasn't frozen over. I'd wager it's still unbearably cold, though.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Jullus...what are your thoughts on magic?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: The average Garlean would jump out of their skin if they saw it. But the Ist has a few foreign signiferi and medici, so it doesn't scare me.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Then I take it you won't mind if I employ a little now.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alphinaud, as you have a knack for finding dry wood, why don't you bring me some? Once that's done, a blast of Verfire should do the trick.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Leave it to me!

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: You're not planning to go in there, are you?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Of course I am. That tank isn't going to fetch itself.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's nothing so involved as extracting unprocessed ceruleum from a frozen lake like how the tappers do it. We're talking about a shallow pond in a park. And we have a way of warming ourselves up after.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: But that's...insane!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So, fancy a dip?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A little friendly competition might make things interesting...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The last thing we need is you catching a cold.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Step aside while I drink the pond dry! That way, we'll find it in no time!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Last one to find a ceruleum tank is a rotten egg! Though I daresay we'll both smell like rotten eggs when this is over...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If you're that concerned for my well-being, you can dive in and help me look! The quicker we find that ceruleum, the sooner we can get out of here.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That may be the stupidest thing I've heard in a while! And that's saying something considering who my brother is.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I can't fault your enthusiasm, though. Let's do it my way first, and if that doesn't work...perhaps then you can try your method. With Alphinaud's help.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: G-G-Gods be good, it's cold! Perhaps we sh-sh-should've listened to Jullus after all!

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: I can't believe what I'm seeing...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You delve into the murky water but come up empty-handed. To add injury to insult, the icy wind on your damp clothing chills you to the bone...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Beneath the water, your fingers catch on what you think might be a handle...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You open the hatch and retrieve a ceruleum tank!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: However, your grand discovery comes at great personal cost, as you become acutely aware of the freezing cold and a rancid odor emanating from every ilm of your body. Jullus will doubtless feel compelled to pinch his nose shut when you deliver to him your prize...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You f-f-found it!? Hmph! There must be another one around here s-s-somewhere!

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Did you find anything? <sniff> <sniff> I hope you did...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: That's it!

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: And there's still some ceruleum left!

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Ah, the fire's still not ready... Hold on, I'll give Alphinaud a hand!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Call me an Ul'dahn because by fire I am reborn...and my clothes are mostly dry now, too.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: I appreciate you recovering the ceruleum, but I wish you'd taken the time to discuss the plan with me beforehand.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Despite the way you've been treated, in Lord Quintus's eyes, you're still envoys deserving of protection. If you were to die on my watch, he would be most displeased.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Your concern is duly noted, but all's well that ends well.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Jullus, you mentioned coming here with your younger siblings. Did you grow up in Garlemald?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: I did. Not far from here.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: My father was an accomplished researcher in his youth, and for his contributions to the Empire awarded an estate. We lived well─better than many.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What was Garlemald like in those days?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: ...Everything. It was everything you could imagine...and so much more.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Even during the coldest winters, we always found warmth and comfort at home.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Coming in from the snow, taking off your coat and sitting down for a hot meal...with family...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Visiting friends and relatives, receiving that same welcome. Knowing they had everything they needed.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Walking down the street, seeing the lights in all the houses, hearing the faint sounds of laughter and song. Of happiness...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: And although the summers came and went all too quickly, in that brief respite, the ice would melt and the forgotten grass make its triumphant return.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Grey clouds gave way to blue skies. Some mornings, we'd climb to the top of the tallest building we could find to watch the sun rise...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: ...Never again. Those rooftops are rubble. Those friends dead, and those memories... But if I could reclaim even a fraction of what we once had...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Soon, our chance will come. We just need to hold on a little longer...
